posting_title: Inventory: Cyber Security Analyst, Senior Analyst, and Specialist
summary_text: CompTIA Security+ certified cybersecurity professional with bootcamp training in incident response, digital forensics, and vulnerability assessment (Splunk, QRadar, Wireshark, Volatility — lab environments). Practical IT and security experience from a small business role: endpoint protection deployment, password management migration, firewall configuration, and PIPEDA-aligned policy creation. Full-stack web development background (Node.js, React, WordPress/WooCommerce) provides application security perspective. VanLUG board member committed to open-source advocacy and inclusive security practices. Seeking to grow into enterprise security operations and contribute to OSFI's mission of protecting Canada's financial infrastructure.
headline: CompTIA Security+ | Incident Response · Vulnerability Management · Cloud & Endpoint Security
job_description: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) hiring multiple Cyber Security positions (RE-04, RE-05, RE-06) across domains including Incident Response, DLP, IAM, Application/Cloud/Endpoint Security, Vulnerability Management, Supply Chain Risk, Threat Intelligence, and GRC. Positions are hybrid (Ottawa/Toronto/Montreal/Vancouver), require Canadian residency/citizenship for some clearances, and emphasize experience in enterprise environments. Essential education: degree or diploma in computer science, computer engineering, cyber security, information security, or related field. Experience levels vary by classification: RE-04 (2–4 years), RE-05 (5–6 years), RE-06 (7+ years). Key competencies include critical thinking, collaboration, and results orientation. Asset qualifications: graduate degree and certifications (CISSP, CISA, CISM, CEH). Candidates must be able to obtain Secret or Top Secret clearance where required.
organization_mission: OSFI's mandate to protect Canada's financial system — ensuring the stability of over 400 federally regulated financial institutions and 1,200 pension plans — through rigorous regulation, supervision, and risk-based cybersecurity controls
interest_points: OSFI's cyber division covers domains I've trained in — Incident Response, Vulnerability Management, Cloud & Application Security, IAM, and Endpoint/Network Monitoring — making this a strong domain match for growing my skills.
Protecting financial infrastructure and federally regulated institutions is mission-critical work that aligns with my commitment to security as a public good.
The hybrid, multi-city model (Ottawa/Toronto/Vancouver/Montreal) supports my preference for remote-flexible work while being willing to travel and work on-site as required.
OSFI's commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion resonates with my identity as a person with disabilities who self-identifies under employment equity provisions.
requirements: Education: Diploma in Cybersecurity (Lighthouse Labs, May 2025) plus prior post-secondary studies (SFU, incomplete).

Incident Response & Digital Forensics: Hands-on bootcamp labs using NIST IR framework, Volatility (memory forensics), Autopsy (disk forensics), Splunk (log analysis), and Wireshark (network analysis). Capstone DFIR investigation with MITRE ATT&CK mapping. Lab experience only — no production IR.

Vulnerability Assessment: OpenVAS scanning in lab environments. Informal security reviews at a small business using self-directed checklists. No production vulnerability management program experience.
Endpoint & Network Security: Deployed Malwarebytes endpoint protection and configured Windows Firewall at a small business. SIEM alert triage (Splunk, QRadar) in bootcamp labs only.
Application Security: OWASP Top 10 awareness, BurpSuite in lab. Full-stack web development background (Node.js, React, WordPress/WooCommerce) provides developer perspective on web app security.
IAM: Configured MFA and migrated to Bitwarden password manager at a small business.
GRC: Applied NIST 800-53 and MITRE ATT&CK in coursework. Created PIPEDA-aligned privacy policies for small ecommerce business.
Communication: Authored technical reports in coursework. Translated security concepts for non-technical small business team.
assets: CompTIA Security+ (SY0-701) — industry-recognized certification directly listed in the posting's asset qualifications.
Actively pursuing additional certifications (Google Cybersecurity Specialization in progress).
Lab experience with Splunk SIEM and log monitoring in bootcamp environments.
Self-identifies as a person with disabilities under Employment Equity — OSFI specifically encourages applications from this group.

cover_letter_context: OSFI's mandate to rigorously regulate and supervise Canada's financial institutions is exactly the kind of mission-critical environment where I want to grow my security career. While my formal experience is from bootcamp training and a small business IT/security role, I bring strong foundational knowledge across incident response, vulnerability assessment, and compliance frameworks, along with genuine motivation to learn enterprise security operations. I am prepared to obtain and maintain the required security clearance, I am bilingual-eligible for English essential positions, and I self-identify under Employment Equity provisions as a person with disabilities.
